pr_title: Add support for maven lambda archetype

timeline.message: Add tests, improve docs and other changes
Add tests, improve docs and other changes

timeline.bodyText: In the future, we should consider showing them how to do true DI with dagger.
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText: Yup. I thought about adding another parameter, something like di, which allows customers to switch between relatively lightweight DI such as dagger or guice or no DI at all.
replies.author: zoewangg

timeline.bodyText: Do we include open SSL or other tweaks for netty?
timeline.author: millems

replies.bodyText: That would require another openssl dependency netty-tcnative though, and not all platforms support it. We can probably add a comment here to recommend using openssl if possible.
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: But since it's on Lambda, we know the platform, right?
replies.author: millems

replies.bodyText: lol, good point. I'll give it a try
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText:
Wow, the netty-tcnative-boringssl-static binding jar itself is 3MB...Certainly wouldn't help with cold start issue, but I guess it would improve overall latency a bit.
5 concurrent s3Async#listBuckets calls with 1024MB mem:

Openssl Duration: 3767.44 ms, Init Duration: 1092.19 ms
JDK: Duration: 3995.94 ms Init Duration: 1108.46 ms
replies.author: zoewangg

replies.bodyText: Ended up just adding netty-tcnative-boringssl-static dependency so that it'd use openssl if supported and fallback to jdk ssl provider otherwise.
replies.author: zoewangg
